WRITING.TEXT: I'm a cutter, I've been doing it for a while now. I got into it when everyone I ever trusted and everyone I thought cared left me and I got a sudden urge to hurt myself, its like sacrificing your own body for a relief even if its temporary. I want to stop but I always fail to hold on over a week before I do it again and recently getting worse.
Im sorry to hear that, nobody should have to go through any type of selfharm and yours sound bad.
Feel you, all the type recently. Worst fear is failing or my parents finding me...

Sometimes it's a matter of who are the people that love you and how they treat you that causes issues like that. Sometimes it's incredibly tough to find good qualities in youself when everyone around you treats you like trash. I agree with you but its very difficult for some and finding people who will actually treat you well and love you is also a thing that can help this situation.

Temporarily you can use makeup and long term you can use many creams exist for that purpose for example: mederma. And some essential oils like carrot seed oils supposedly help healing and discoloration I'd suggest you look into it. If your scars arent old give them a couple of month they will probably be alot less discolored.

Admitting a problem is the first part of improvement, I have a very similiar situation. Its hell trust me I probably know I'm not someone in the right to talk about inprovement for many reasons but I believe making a list of thing you'd like to accomplish will get you a good start and some motivation, try making some friends and find people that will care about you even if it's online or find a few things that are worth spending your time on. A hope I could somehow help you, if you wish to talk, have a question or want advise we are here don't be afraid to ask.

No matter how hated you believe you are there will be some else whose life will be crushed. I wont tell you not to if it werent for my friends that supported me I wouldnt be here I have intense self esteem issues and self hatred caused by multiple childhood traumas it might never get better but some things are worth living for when you find them. Even if everyone around you hate you, you are special and interesting in your own ways and I'm sure you will be able to find that too if you look hard enough. I wish you a happy final week if you do go for it and quick one.. if you change your mind good luck on your journey #10084;
Should get whiter or disappear mostly by then, creams will speed it up for sure.
You're loved and appreciated, you matter and special in your ways you're perfect the way you are no matter how broken and hurting you could be. We are here for you!
Yes should help your case, dealing with scars is hard I wear only long sleeves #128517; good luck :)
Good luck! Do your best :) if you wish to talk we're here, you can dm me anytime.
I believe the the head specifically under the jaw but, please don't go for it there are other ways to cope and to continue living on, it may be hard but we're here we can help.

Paracetamol can't kill a person, it destroys the liver (3 pills already cause some damage). Suicide is never a way out, life can be extreme but everything eventually fades, if you need help or someone to talk to we're here and the people that love you are there. If anyone has suicidal tendencies talk it'll get better.
You won't die, just won't have a good time at all.

7 billion people on earth none of them are similiar in the slightest, therefore we can't understand you completely. But we can still hear you out love you and support you, you can talk to us. A person gone is an entire world gone, not only for you but to your friends family colleagues ect.

I felt the same exact thing with my best friend, he was like my brother , at the moment I'm losing him(irrelevant). if you wish to support your family or any loved ones be there when they need you hear them out and give a shoulder to cry on, if they need it show then you care and that they matter to you , it really makes a difference to them.
Some lives won't be beautiful and the moment is more powerful than the person sonetimes.
You can write me anytime, I'm always open for advice, questions, help ect. I spend a good amount if time on reddit so I'm avalible during nost of the day.

I live with abusive parents (a lot less now) had a few traumatic incidents. Lead into ongoing severe anxiety and depression, insomnia and ptsd (couldn't lay on my back for YEARS without having a panic attack it's much better now I still have nightmares and discomfort when laying on my back though.). Yes childhood pretty much determines how your life will be.
I have keloids on my belly area and my leg, it triggers me when I see guys in like super short pants and I don't like it when people walk shirtless around me.

You shouldn't be disappointed, you can't control what trigger you and when. I'm sure you're a great person and that you're strong and capable, you should talk to her about it, I'm sure she would understand and I believe it would be right to offer her helps and support if needed. Good luck! I'm sure you'll do what's right.

Nylon bandages should work bandage wise, they cost a little more but you should get allergic reactions to them. 74 days is amazing you breaking doesn't take any of that away, my longest is 5 days haha.

I stick to lemon juice (helps redness fade really well) and oils, I heard silicone gel is good. Every treatment method takes time and they might look worse at first but stick to it and in a 2-3 weeks there will be a positive difference. Your tatto is very nice by the way and I hope your scars get better.
I scratch into my leg or my arm, sometimes I use a key.

Yup, keloids(Judgung by the look of it) are usually left by cuts that needed stitches, it's a result of tissue fibrosis that was caused by a deep wound that wasn't closed (in this case), if you would've gotten stitches or used other closing methods they probably would've been much smaller and not as "narly?".
I have many, I'm not proud of them and I'm afraid of the judgement people will give me. I'm glad to hear you got help and that you're doing well, keep it up and stay away from sh :).
How old are they? And I'd recommend butterfly bandages or steri-strips, do wonders minimizing scars.

Yeah borderline keloids. I never used butterflies I prefer strips, but they're great, just make sure you follow safety intructions (don't pull them, don't wet until healed ect. You can find them online or ask me). If you need advice or have a question I'm open, good luck!

Yes, it's normal they're called keloids they fade over time but may take a while (you can get surgery to make them fade instantly or use different methods at home). They are a result of tissue fibrosis (literally tissue turning into fibers) caused by a lot of damage to the original tissue and much of the damage can be mitigated scar wise by stitches they also would've healed faster (MUCH faster). So don't worry you're fine if you have any other questions I'm open.
Will be 17 tomorrow. Feel free to DM me.
The reasons are not known for sure yet it's speculated that it's either lesions under the keloid hurting, abnormal function of small nerves in the keloid or over-stretching of the skin.

I have or rather had a super close friend, more than a brother, he was pretty much the only family, support and care I've had in 17 years of life. I spend everything on him, money wise time wise and everything I ever do I take him into consideration. And like he's drifting away pushed me to the side with "You have parents", funny how ironic it is, I haven't seen him privately in a month and I'm struggling with many other issues. Sometimes I plan suicides and shit, I never go according to plan for my dog. I feel like I'm not worth the time of anyone but it's not like that you,me we all are worth every bit of love in the world and everything well one person leaving could be a massive blow but you'll get over it eventually and it'll be all well.
Thank you haha.
No offense to anybody but true story. Like yeah free validation from the web for destroying my body heck yeah!

It'll be a small keloid probably (from experience) like deep red fiborous probably win't stick out much, it'll take about 3 weeks to heal completely and quite a while to fade out completely. Make sure it's clean and eat well, aloe vera, honey and things to keep it moisturized will help speed up healing process also bandages help. Burns are nasty. Makes me want to do it again. Haha.
That's great! I like coloring in my whole arm when I have strong cravings I also draw a small thing every morning on my arm just so I remember to stay away from it.

Yeah, people can suck gosh do I know, they aren't worth your pain and you should try coping differently I don't rely on people not anymore and never again, too unreliable. I'm sure you're strong and powerful enough to find your path with or without people. If you need someone to talk yo you can DM me freely.

I never relied on people got really close to a certain person and relied on him then I got sent to "bitch to my parents" and now I'm kinda alone lol. God some people suck lol. Feel free to dm me anytime.
What happened that made you still be here? Just out of curiousity.
Is the tatto a satanic approach of the pentagram or the wiccan? It's an interesting choice for a tattoo to be honest, looks great!
They'll fade in a hot minute, 4 months is amazing keep it up!

In my opinion yes there was a need for stitches but it looks great for a cut like that, any cut that passes all layers of skin and reaches subcon fat probably needs stitches but it's not a must it'll just leave a nasty scar or a keloid.
That's great, gosh animals are the only good people aren't they? Haha, stay strong and live a good life!
Bracelet tatto of maybe roses? Or an ouroborus (as a symbol wholeness like feeling whole?), I think a sakura branch bracelet would look amazing (symbolizes renewal and optimism).

Looks anemiac to me, you should get a ferrotin or hemoglobin test and a cell count (sorry just a thing I noticed #128517; light blood is usually anemiac) anyways you still held up for 2 months it doesn't take that away relapse is a part of recovery, give it a other attempt I'm sure you'll hold out well.
If you don't feel dizzy,lightheaded or weak you're fine even if you do you're not at risk I'd just recommend getting a test for the long term.
Alright, take care.

How old are they? Recent scars are often discolored (as a result of over production of collagen in the skin it goes away overtime) and older ones are lacking in pigmentation if contain pigmentation at all therefore scars maybe be of lighter color or colorless.
It'll probably leave a small white streak give it some time.

Yes, it happens alot and if you feel the need to cut because of it please leave the sub it'll do you better, your sh is as valid as someone with keloid scars or hundreds of scars sh is a way to cope with this shitty life it's not a contest.

That's what you would call a scar, won't fade any more than it has already. if it makes you worried they're hardly noticeable (just don't get a tan xd) and you can easily cover than up with makeup (even if you're a guy literally doesn't matter).

They'll turn white in a few months up (maximum 6 months usually) after that you'll have a bunch of small white streaks. you can use oils and creams to speed up the healing (primarily moisturizers and oils aloe vera also works well as well as honey? and different things to speed up the healing and the regeneration of skin cells).

Umm a little past the epidermis (upper layer of skin) about as minor as depth goes I guess. now this doesn't mean you're invalid or you should cut deeper, remember depth doesn't mean your pain is any less valid or any weaker.
Then you didn't cut into the skin you made surface cuts.... and people scar differently so you can't compare in that regard.
I made a flower pattern all over my abdomen with burns, have some pretty nasty scars.
Mind me asking how do people react to these? They are in such an open place.

I've went through drugs abuse, shitty parents, shitty friends, bullying, abuse and yes list goes on and yet I feel like it's nothing compared to others, it's like a "there's always a bigger fish" situation for me, sometimes it makes me feel invalid which is wrong. Looking in the mirror hurts but we must keep going because what worth would we have if we gave up and died?

It's a great thing to do while struggling, thing is it can seriously fuck your life over espacially if you're young, they have to report to goverment services if you're being suicidal and then they throw you into a mental ward and in some countries it really ruins job oprotunities and many living positions for adults. I have a hotline on speed dile just case though.
Well holdin up in quarantine lol, it's introvert time now. Lovin the novo 2, stay strong!

I've practiced SH for a while now with different methods, sometimes seeing sh scars or fresh cuts can trigger me cutting when I'm anxious and/or upset, it also happens that I feel invalid when I see very bad scars and I heard of many people feeling the same, on the contrary people can get help, support, advice and a getaway with people who can relate, I always find in these sort of subs some place to commit to or help people, makes me feel better and helpful. If you want you may include my POV and my username. Good luck on your paper! By the way r/selfharmpics moved to the site selfharm.pics incase that's of any help to you.

Scars can't tan.... the skin loses all pigmentation in scar tissue therefore can't tan, as soon as the scar fades complitely you won't have any pigment until then the pigment is red and exposure to sunlight can make them worse and slower to fade....
White as far as I can tell, maybe a little bumpy.
I think they'll stay like they are.

At this point bio oil won't help the scar has faded as much as it will. Laser treatment is honestly too extreme for this lol, I'm not sure doctor would agree to doing laser. Relax it's a few small scars nobody will ask anything and if they do you can say a friend's cat doesn't like you or something, people don't really care.

If you apply it constantly they might blend in a little, but permanently they won't change much. I know it's hard to accept them but you'll have to learn how, they are a part of you that symbolizes you surviving and you fighting, a product of the past. Some people even get attached to their scars.
Low chances.

Wow that's extreme measures, they don't look that bad you probably could pull them off as a cat scratch or something similiar, I have a puppy that bites me and my left arm looks like I slashed it all over (I don't touch arms recently after realizing how hot Ill be in a hoodie haha).
Yeah, I'm holding up fine, hairs growing out is a great sign, means you didn't cause much skin damage, it'll be fine, good luck and take care of youself.

You don't have to cover them anymore, and anti septics aren't a must, still would recommend you to still put some on them, they are about half healed and will take around a week to become completely healed.

Keloids are formed for unknown reasons, although pigmentation plays a factor (darker skin means higher risk for raised keloids) and depth plays a factor (obviously deeper means the scar will be more raised). Very deep burns (and burns you pop and pick) and picking fat can cause the scar to be sunken in unless the scar turns keloid.
More depth = more riased and a bunch of genetic things .

1st of all, that cut proabably bearly breached the surface not even close to a suicide attempt 2nd of all a suicide attempt is slashing the veins vertically cause horizontally won't be remotly enough to kill you no matter how many veins you hit in one slash.... so don't make up stuff and exaggerate.

It's internal bleeding, not severe, infact it's common with puncture wounds and common in people that smoke nicotine or have problems with smaller blood vessels (caused by chronic diseases like diabetes and things like that), now this doesn't mean you're sick in any way shape or form so no need to worry you're all good.

Ok look they're what's called keloid scars meaning an overloaded panic indused attemp of the body to heal the skin with fiborous collagen tissue resulting in raised scars that are often itchy and take a while to go white, they take UP TO 2.5 years for them to go white 100%, now this doesn't mean you should worry, keloid scars often vary in different people.
He's actually gorgeous, very unusual labrador color!

They won't, they'll turn white but won't ever go away, they'll stay but they'll tell your story of pain of suffering and eventually recovery, they'll be there to remind you that we all go through hardships and but eventually recover, try not to be too hard on yourself for now.
I heard most tattoo artists won't do one until it's fully faded (fully white), usually because it won't turn out well while it's still red, full heal takes around 6 months.
I heard its like the Equus sit on one feed it crystal when needed, I don't know how reliable the source is though.
For real wow.

Ok correction on official crystal isles the tropical wyvern is a pure traditional passive tame with primal crystals that drop upon knocking out a wyvern (takes around 12 on x1 taming for a 140) other kinds are egg tames.

scars don't get tan they lack that pigmentation and therefore discoloured you can maybe try foundation or some other makeup product as a guy I don't understand anything about it but it seems to work seamlessly, you could also resort to sleeves which suck honestly.
